segment.source: Set conditions for running a background task
segment.target: Set conditions for running a background task

segment.source: Learn how to set conditions that control when your background task will run.
segment.target: Learn how to set conditions that control when your background task will run.

segment.source: Set conditions for running a background task
segment.target: Set conditions for running a background task

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: SystemCondition
segment.target: SystemCondition

segment.source: SystemConditionType
segment.target: SystemConditionType

segment.source: BackgroundTaskBuilder
segment.target: BackgroundTaskBuilder

segment.source: Learn how to set conditions that control when your background task will run.
segment.target: Learn how to set conditions that control when your background task will run.

segment.source: Sometimes, background tasks require certain conditions to be met, in addition to the event that triggers the task, so that the background task can succeed.
segment.target: Sometimes, background tasks require certain conditions to be met, in addition to the event that triggers the task, so that the background task can succeed.

segment.source: You can specify one or more of the conditions specified by SystemConditionType when registering your background task.
segment.target: You can specify one or more of the conditions specified by SystemConditionType when registering your background task.

segment.source: The condition will be checked after the trigger has been fired; the background task will be queued, but it will not run until all the required conditions are satisfied.
segment.target: The condition will be checked after the trigger has been fired; the background task will be queued, but it will not run until all the required conditions are satisfied.

segment.source: Putting conditions on background tasks saves battery life and CPU runtime by preventing tasks from running unnecessarily.
segment.target: Putting conditions on background tasks saves battery life and CPU runtime by preventing tasks from running unnecessarily.

segment.source: For example, if your background task runs on a timer and requires Internet connectivity, add the InternetAvailable condition to the TaskBuilder before registering the task.
segment.target: For example, if your background task runs on a timer and requires Internet connectivity, add the InternetAvailable condition to the TaskBuilder before registering the task.

segment.source: This will help prevent the task from using system resources and battery life unnecessarily by letting it run when the timer has elapsed and the Internet is available.
segment.target: This will help prevent the task from using system resources and battery life unnecessarily by letting it run when the timer has elapsed and the Internet is available.

segment.source: Note It is possible to combine multiple conditions by calling AddCondition multiple times on the same TaskBuilder.
segment.target: Note It is possible to combine multiple conditions by calling AddCondition multiple times on the same TaskBuilder.

segment.source: Take care not to add conflicting conditions, such as UserPresent and UserNotPresent.
segment.target: Take care not to add conflicting conditions, such as UserPresent and UserNotPresent.

segment.source: Create a SystemCondition object
segment.target: Create a SystemCondition object

segment.source: This topic assumes that you have a background task already associated with your app, and that your app already includes code that creates a BackgroundTaskBuilder object named taskBuilder
segment.target: This topic assumes that you have a background task already associated with your app, and that your app already includes code that creates a BackgroundTaskBuilder object named taskBuilder

segment.source: Before adding the condition, create a SystemCondition object representing the condition that must be in effect for a background task to run.
segment.target: Before adding the condition, create a SystemCondition object representing the condition that must be in effect for a background task to run.

segment.source: In the constructor, specify the condition that must be met by providing a SystemConditionType enumeration value.
segment.target: In the constructor, specify the condition that must be met by providing a SystemConditionType enumeration value.

segment.target: The following code creates a SystemCondition object specifying Internet availability as the conditional requirement:

segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Add the SystemCondition object to your background task
segment.target: Add the SystemCondition object to your background task

segment.source: To add the condition, call the AddCondition method on the BackgroundTaskBuilder object, and pass it the SystemCondition object.
segment.target: To add the condition, call the AddCondition method on the BackgroundTaskBuilder object, and pass it the SystemCondition object.

segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Register your background task
segment.target: Register your background task

segment.source: Now you can register your background task with the Register method, and the task will not start until the specified condition is met.
segment.target: Now you can register your background task with the Register method, and the task will not start until the specified condition is met.

segment.source: The following code registers the task and stores the resulting BackgroundTaskRegistration object:
segment.target: The following code registers the task and stores the resulting BackgroundTaskRegistration object:

segment.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
segment.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

segment.source: Note Universal Windows apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any of the background trigger types.
segment.target: Note Universal Windows apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any of the background trigger types.

segment.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.
segment.target: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.

segment.source: For more information, see Guidelines for background tasks.
segment.target: For more information, see Guidelines for background tasks.

segment.source: Note Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.
segment.target: Note Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.

segment.source: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.
segment.target: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.

segment.source: Ensure that your app gracefully handles scenarios where background task registration fails - if instead your app depends on having a valid registration object after attempting to register a task, it may crash.
segment.target: Ensure that your app gracefully handles scenarios where background task registration fails - if instead your app depends on having a valid registration object after attempting to register a task, it may crash.

segment.source: Place multiple conditions on your background task
segment.target: Place multiple conditions on your background task

segment.source: To add multiple conditions, your app makes multiple calls to the AddCondition method.
segment.target: To add multiple conditions, your app makes multiple calls to the AddCondition method.

segment.source: These calls must come before task registration to be effective.
segment.target: These calls must come before task registration to be effective.

segment.source: Note Take care not to add conflicting conditions to a background task.
segment.target: Note Take care not to add conflicting conditions to a background task.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: Note Choose the right conditions for your background task so that it only runs when it's needed, and doesn't run when it won't work.
segment.target: Note Choose the right conditions for your background task so that it only runs when it's needed, and doesn't run when it won't work.

segment.source: See SystemConditionType for descriptions of the different background task conditions.
segment.target: See SystemConditionType for descriptions of the different background task conditions.

segment.source: Note This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: Note This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
segment.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
